function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Negative psychological effects of certain \\'nature\\' elements , fear of snakes, spiders leading to mental health impacts.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The emotional need for \\'nature\\' is explained as an inherited affection from the experience of choosing habitats and building dwellings, which can lead to a preference for natural characteristics in modern architectural spaces.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contact with natural features vegetation and water can generate a quick and positive psychological reaction, reducing negative emotions and fostering recovery from physiological stress and health problems.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Connecting to the local natural environment through incorporating regional features geomorphology and landscape in buildings could generate the \\'sense of place\\' and \\'sense of community\\' and realize personal identity, belonging, and cohesion.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of snowball method to identify publications may result in biased selection of literature, leading to incomplete understanding of biophilic design.","category":"Health","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Selection of limited literature on the development of relevant concepts may lead to a narrow perspective on the emergence of biophilic design.","category":"Health","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Limited representation of interdisciplinary knowledge may restrict the applicability of biophilic design to address contagious disease propagation in the built buildings.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of contact with nature in the built environment","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of the emotional needs of humans for interactions with the natural environment in the building environment","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Shift in focus of biophilia theory leading to neglect of human-nature relationship","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of access to gardens, parks, or countryside during covid-19
